title: Letters to the Editor for Oct. 20, 2015
text: To the Editor: What is “The Drowsy Chaperone”? It’s a fun- filled rib-tickling evening of hilarious entertainment! Bob and I had never heard of it either! But boy we’re so glad we went to see it. One of the best comedies S.R.T. has put on in years! S.R.T’s very own Scott Viets, The Man in the Chair, plays a magnificent role, as an eloquently playful, perky, oh so effervescent, bright eyed theater enthusiast. Through him we get lost in a show of silliness wrapped around exceptionally talented dancers, amazing singers and 2 hours or so of comedy of the like we have never experienced. It really is a must see! We will go again, not a habit of ours, but it is such a busy and amusing show in a show I’m sure we missed some good moments. It’s only here for 4 weeks so get your tickets now! Ruth and Bob Garretson Ways to make a difference To the Editor: Thank you for the timely article regarding school counselors by Sean Carson. Margie Bulkin should be commended for her efforts to provide a school counselor for all schools. Too many people think of school counselors as testers and therapists working with individual students only.
